```{r}

head(df)
```
```{r}
labels = subset(df, select="satisfaction")
unique(labels)
```
Unnecessary columns are removed (X and id do not contribute meaningful information)
```{r}
df <- subset(df, select=-c(X, id))
```
```{r}
names(df)
```



The non-numerical (categorical) columns need be encoded in order for logistic regression to be carried out. The CatEncoders package from CRAN is used to do this on all non-numeric columns, and both X and id are droped from the dataframe
```{r}
df = subset(df, select= -c(satisfaction))
```

```{r}
cols <- c("Gender", "Customer.Type", "Type.of.Travel", "Class")
df_enc = df

gender_enc = LabelEncoder.fit(c(df$Gender))
df_enc$Gender = transform(gender_enc, c(df$Gender))

ctype_enc = LabelEncoder.fit(c(df$Customer.Type))
df_enc$Customer.Type = transform(ctype_enc, c(df$Customer.Type))

ttype_enc = LabelEncoder.fit(c(df$Type.of.Travel))
df_enc$Type.of.Travel = transform(ttype_enc, c(df$Type.of.Travel))

class_enc = LabelEncoder.fit(c(df$Class))
df_enc$Class = transform(class_enc, c(df$Class))

head(df_enc)

```
